Olivier Assayas' film stars Asia Argento as a woman who had a relationship with Michael Madsen. Things get nasty when one of his friends has a client overdose, allegedly, on heroine injected to her vagina and potentially leaked to him afterwards.

River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, but the crowning descision made by director Vincent Ward is the complete lack of subtitles for any of this movie's non-English dialogue. As a result, River Queen plays like an acid trip where you don't laugh at or freak out over what others are seeing; instead you watch "the best bits"

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you back again to watch it.

Hordecore , Hello Lutenist and Turmoil Academy are back with this super dark album

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have long since left Planet Earth, for adventures in the countless empires that make up the Galaxy beyond. Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to catch the wave of martial arts popularity ; It borrows many characteristics and themes from Asian and American cinema alike, meshing them with over the top humour to provide a light hearted romp for audiences of all ages.
